summary: The bill, the "Improving Seniors' Timely Access to Care Act of 2025," aims to reform prior authorization processes within Medicare Advantage plans. It mandates electronic prior authorization programs, transparency in data reporting (including denial rates, appeal outcomes, and processing times), and enrollee protection standards. The bill also grants the Secretary authority to enforce timely responses to prior authorization requests and outlines reporting requirements for various entities, including the Government Accountability Office (GAO) and the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), focusing on real-time decisions and patient access.
